titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Society of Samoset, Inc. records 1993.004
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

did.abstract: This collection contains the Society of Samoset, Inc., a social club for young men founded in the Bedford-Stuyvesant neighborhood of Brooklyn in 1912. The collection includes the club's constitution and bylaws, a handwritten essay about the Samoset Baseball Club of 1912-1919, a 60th anniversary program containing a typewritten history of the Society, and a description of the club's initiation rituals.
